panels.title: Member Health (Relevant for multi node only)

panels.description: See which node is currently acting as the primary, secondary, ...
panels.title: Member State (Relevant for multi node only)

panels.tableColumn: mongodb_connections{endpoint="metrics", instance="$host", job="{{ .Release.Namespace }}-mongodb-service", namespace="{{ .Release.Namespace }}", pod="{{ .Release.Namespace }}-mongodb-replicaset-0", service="{{ .Release.Namespace }}-mongodb-service", state="available"}
panels.title: Available Connections

panels.tableColumn: mongodb_connections{endpoint="metrics", instance="$host", job="{{ .Release.Namespace }}-mongodb-service", namespace="{{ .Release.Namespace }}", pod="{{ .Release.Namespace }}-mongodb-replicaset-0", service="{{ .Release.Namespace }}-mongodb-service", state="current"}
panels.title: Open Connections
Oplog Size (Relevant for multi node only)

alert.message:
A MongoDB oplog replication has been 5 minutes behind in its replication for more than 15 minutes.
Being able to fail over to a replica of your data is only useful if the data is up to date, so you need to know when that’s no longer the case!
alert.name: MongoDB Oplog lag alert

panels.title: Oplog Lag (Relevant for multi node only)

targets.expr:
rate(mongodb_op_counters_total{instance="$host", type!="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_op_counters_total{instance="$host", type!="command"}[5m]) or 
rate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_total{instance="$host", type!="command"}[$interval]) or 
irate(mongodb_mongos_op_counters_total{instance="$host", type!="command"}[5m])
